obligations.description: Devote full working time, attention, and best efforts to job duties
obligations.source_text: Employee agrees to devote Employee's full working time, attention, and best efforts to the performance of Employee's duties

obligations.description: Comply with all Company policies, procedures, rules, and regulations
obligations.source_text: Employee shall comply with all Company policies, procedures, rules, and regulations as may be established and modified from time to time in the Company's sole discretion

obligations.description: Relocate to any Company location domestic or international as business needs dictate
obligations.source_text: The Company reserves the right to require Employee to relocate to any other Company location, domestic or international, as business needs dictate, with or without additional compensation

obligations.description: Submit PTO requests at least 2 weeks in advance
obligations.source_text: PTO requests must be submitted at least two (2) weeks in advance and are subject to approval by Employee's supervisor

obligations.description: Submit expense reports within 30 days of incurring expense
obligations.source_text: Employee must submit expense reports with supporting documentation within thirty (30) days of incurring the expense. Failure to submit timely expense reports may result in forfeiture of reimbursement

obligations.description: Hold all Confidential Information in strict confidence and not disclose to third parties
obligations.source_text: Employee agrees to hold all Confidential Information in strict confidence and not to disclose any Confidential Information to any third party without the Company's prior written consent. This obligation shall continue indefinitely and shall survive termination of employment

obligations.description: Not use Confidential Information for any purpose other than job duties
obligations.source_text: Employee agrees not to use any Confidential Information for any purpose other than the performance of Employee's duties for the Company, both during and after employment

obligations.description: Return all Company property and materials containing Confidential Information upon termination
obligations.source_text: Upon termination of employment or upon the Company's request, Employee shall immediately return to the Company all documents, materials, equipment, and other property containing or relating to Confidential Information

obligations.description: Assign all Work Product and IP rights to Company
obligations.source_text: Employee hereby irrevocably assigns and transfers to the Company all right, title, and interest in and to all Work Product, including all intellectual property rights therein. Employee agrees to execute any documents and take any actions necessary to effectuate such assignment

obligations.description: Waive all moral rights in Work Product
obligations.source_text: To the extent permitted by applicable law, Employee hereby waives any and all moral rights Employee may have in any Work Product, including rights of attribution, integrity, disclosure, and withdrawal

obligations.description: Non-compete: Cannot work for competitors for 24 months post-termination, worldwide
obligations.source_text: During the term of Employee's employment and for a period of twenty-four (24) months following the termination of employment for any reason, Employee shall not, directly or indirectly, anywhere in the world: (a) Engage in, own, manage, operate, control, be employed by, participate in, or be connected with any business or enterprise that competes with the Company's business

obligations.description: Cannot provide services to named competitors (Microsoft, Google, Amazon, Apple, Meta, etc.)
obligations.source_text: Provide services, whether as an employee, consultant, advisor, or in any other capacity, to any Competitor... "Competitor" means any person, entity, or business that engages in the development, production, marketing, or sale of software, technology products, or services that are similar to or competitive with the Company's products or services, including but not limited to: Microsoft, Google, Amazon, Apple, Meta, Salesforce, Oracle, SAP

obligations.description: Non-solicitation: Cannot solicit or hire Company employees for 24 months post-termination
obligations.source_text: During the term of Employee's employment and for a period of twenty-four (24) months following the termination of employment for any reason, Employee shall not, directly or indirectly: (a) Solicit, recruit, hire, or attempt to solicit, recruit, or hire any employee, contractor, or consultant of the Company to leave the Company's employ

obligations.description: Cannot solicit Company customers or interfere with business relationships for 24 months
obligations.source_text: Solicit, contact, or do business with any customer, client, vendor, or business partner of the Company for the purpose of providing products or services competitive with the Company's products or services

obligations.description: Non-disparagement: Cannot make negative statements about Company indefinitely
obligations.source_text: Employee agrees not to make any disparaging, defamatory, or derogatory statements about the Company, its products, services, officers, directors, employees, shareholders, or business practices to any third party, including but not limited to: customers, vendors, competitors, media, government agencies, or on social media platforms. This obligation shall survive termination of employment and shall continue indefinitely

obligations.description: Provide 4 weeks written notice to resign
obligations.source_text: Employee may terminate employment by providing at least four (4) weeks' prior written notice to the Company

obligations.description: Upon termination, immediately return all Company property and resign from positions
obligations.source_text: Upon termination for any reason, Employee shall: (a) Immediately return all Company property, including but not limited to: laptop, phone, access cards, documents, files, and any materials containing Confidential Information; (b) Resign from any positions held with the Company or its affiliates; (c) Cooperate with the Company in transitioning Employee's duties and responsibilities

obligations.description: Execute general release of claims to receive severance
obligations.source_text: If Employee's employment is terminated by the Company without Cause, and provided Employee executes a general release of claims in a form acceptable to the Company within the time period specified, Employee shall be entitled to: (a) Continued payment of base salary for six (6) months following termination; (b) COBRA premium subsidies for up to six (6) months

obligations.description: Pay Company's attorneys' fees if Company must enforce agreement
obligations.source_text: Employee agrees to pay all of the Company's costs and expenses, including reasonable attorneys' fees, incurred in enforcing any provision of this Agreement

obligations.description: Grant Company perpetual exclusive license to Prior Inventions if incorporated into products
obligations.conditions: If Prior Invention incorporated into Company product
obligations.source_text: To the extent any Prior Invention is incorporated into any Company product or service, Employee hereby grants the Company a perpetual, irrevocable, worldwide, royalty-free, fully paid-up, exclusive license to use, modify, reproduce, distribute, and create derivative works of such Prior Invention

obligations.description: Pay base salary of $175,000 annually
obligations.source_text: Employee shall receive an annual base salary of One Hundred Seventy-Five Thousand Dollars ($175,000.00), payable in accordance with the Company's regular payroll practices

risk_flags.title: 24-month worldwide non-compete
risk_flags.description: Two-year non-compete covering the entire world is extremely broad and likely unenforceable in many jurisdictions. May effectively prevent employee from working in tech industry
risk_flags.source_text: for a period of twenty-four (24) months following the termination of employment for any reason, Employee shall not, directly or indirectly, anywhere in the world: (a) Engage in, own, manage, operate, control, be employed by, participate in, or be connected with any business or enterprise that competes with the Company's business

risk_flags.title: Named competitors include all major tech companies
risk_flags.description: Explicit prohibition on working for Microsoft, Google, Amazon, Apple, Meta, Salesforce, Oracle, SAP effectively bars employment at most major tech companies
risk_flags.source_text: "Competitor" means... including but not limited to: Microsoft, Google, Amazon, Apple, Meta, Salesforce, Oracle, SAP, and any of their affiliates or subsidiaries

risk_flags.title: 24-month employee non-solicitation
risk_flags.description: Two-year restriction on hiring former colleagues is at the longer end of typical restrictions
risk_flags.source_text: for a period of twenty-four (24) months following the termination of employment... Employee shall not... Solicit, recruit, hire, or attempt to solicit, recruit, or hire any employee, contractor, or consultant of the Company

risk_flags.title: Perpetual one-sided non-disparagement
risk_flags.description: Employee prohibited from negative statements forever, but Company has no reciprocal obligation
risk_flags.source_text: Employee agrees not to make any disparaging, defamatory, or derogatory statements about the Company... This obligation shall survive termination of employment and shall continue indefinitely

risk_flags.title: At-will with no employee protections
risk_flags.description: Company can terminate at any time without notice or cause, while employee must give 4 weeks notice
risk_flags.source_text: The Company may terminate Employee's employment at any time, with or without cause, and with or without notice

risk_flags.title: Extremely broad definition of 'Cause'
risk_flags.description: Cause includes 'any breach of Company policy' and 'any other reason the Company determines constitutes cause' - essentially any reason
risk_flags.source_text: "Cause" shall mean: (a) Any breach of this Agreement or any Company policy... (f) Any other reason the Company determines constitutes cause

risk_flags.title: Mandatory relocation without additional compensation
risk_flags.description: Company can require relocation anywhere in the world 'with or without additional compensation'
risk_flags.source_text: The Company reserves the right to require Employee to relocate to any other Company location, domestic or international, as business needs dictate, with or without additional compensation

risk_flags.title: No PTO payout on termination
risk_flags.description: Unused PTO is forfeited upon termination - not paid out
risk_flags.source_text: Unused PTO shall not carry over to the following calendar year and shall not be paid out upon termination of employment

risk_flags.title: Bonus requires employment on payment date
risk_flags.description: Must be employed on payment date to receive bonus - no prorated bonus if terminated
risk_flags.source_text: Bonus eligibility requires Employee to be actively employed on the date of payment. No partial or prorated bonuses will be paid if employment terminates for any reason prior to the payment date

risk_flags.title: Broad IP assignment including personal projects
risk_flags.description: All inventions related to Company business or using Company resources belong to Company, even if created off-hours
risk_flags.source_text: All inventions... that Employee conceives, develops, or creates, alone or jointly with others, during Employee's employment with the Company, that (a) relate to the Company's business, products, or services, (b) result from any work performed for the Company, or (c) are developed using Company resources or Confidential Information, shall be the sole and exclusive property of the Company

risk_flags.title: Exclusive license to Prior Inventions
risk_flags.description: If any pre-existing invention is incorporated into Company work, Company gets perpetual EXCLUSIVE license - employee loses rights to their own prior work
risk_flags.source_text: Employee hereby grants the Company a perpetual, irrevocable, worldwide, royalty-free, fully paid-up, exclusive license to use, modify, reproduce, distribute, and create derivative works of such Prior Invention

risk_flags.title: Mandatory arbitration for all claims
risk_flags.description: All disputes including discrimination and harassment claims must go to binding arbitration
risk_flags.source_text: Any dispute, claim, or controversy arising out of or relating to this Agreement or Employee's employment with the Company, including claims for wrongful termination, discrimination, harassment, retaliation, or violation of any federal, state, or local law, shall be resolved exclusively through final and binding arbitration

risk_flags.title: Class action waiver
risk_flags.description: Employee waives right to participate in class actions
risk_flags.source_text: EMPLOYEE AGREES TO BRING ANY CLAIMS AGAINST THE COMPANY IN EMPLOYEE'S INDIVIDUAL CAPACITY ONLY AND NOT AS A PLAINTIFF OR CLASS MEMBER IN ANY PURPORTED CLASS, COLLECTIVE, OR REPRESENTATIVE PROCEEDING

risk_flags.title: Employee pays Company's enforcement costs
risk_flags.description: Employee must pay Company's attorneys' fees for any enforcement action
risk_flags.source_text: Employee agrees to pay all of the Company's costs and expenses, including reasonable attorneys' fees, incurred in enforcing any provision of this Agreement

risk_flags.title: Non-compete extended by duration of violation
risk_flags.description: If employee violates non-compete, the restricted period is extended by the length of violation
risk_flags.source_text: If Employee breaches any provision of Sections 9 or 10, the restricted period shall be extended by the duration of the violation

key_definitions.definition: Any and all information proprietary to the Company including trade secrets, inventions, software code, APIs, databases, business plans, financial information, pricing, customer lists, marketing strategies, and personnel information
All inventions, discoveries, designs, software, code, documentation created during employment that relate to Company business, result from Company work, or use Company resources

Any business that develops, produces, markets, or sells software or technology products similar to Company's, explicitly including Microsoft, Google, Amazon, Apple, Meta, Salesforce, Oracle, SAP and their affiliates
Any breach of agreement/policy, misconduct, dishonesty, failure to perform, conviction of crime, conduct reflecting adversely on Company, or any other reason Company determines

_annotation_notes: This employment agreement is extremely employer-favorable with: worldwide 24-month non-compete, at-will termination asymmetry, broad IP assignment, perpetual non-disparagement, and mandatory arbitration. The non-compete naming specific major tech companies would likely be unenforceable in California and many other states. The broad 'Cause' definition essentially makes all terminations 'for cause.'
